intro: Odina obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed odina, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Odina obovata is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
